instructions.name: add_admin
docs: Adds a new admin account.

accounts.name: owner
docs: The signer must be the owner.

accounts.name: tbr_config
docs: Program Config account. This program requires that the [`owner`] specified
in the context equals the owner role stored in the config.

instructions.name: cancel_owner_transfer_request
docs: The owner role transfer is cancelled by the current one.

accounts.name: tbr_config
docs: Program Config account. This program requires that the [`signer`] specified
in the context equals a pubkey specified in this account. Mutable,
because we will update roles depending on the operation.

instructions.name: complete_transfer
docs: Complete a transfer initiated from another chain.

accounts.name: payer
docs: Payer will pay for completing the Wormhole transfer tokens and create temporary
token account.

accounts.name: tbr_config
docs: This program's config.

accounts.name: mint
docs: Mint info. This is the SPL token that will be bridged over to the
foreign contract. Mutable.
In the case of a native transfer, it's the mint for the token wrapped by Wormhole;
in the case of a wrapped transfer, it's the native SPL token mint.

accounts.name: recipient_token_account
docs: Recipient associated token account. The recipient authority check
is necessary to ensure that the recipient is the intended recipient
of the bridged tokens. Mutable.

accounts.name: recipient
docs: transaction. This instruction verifies that the recipient key
passed in this context matches the intended recipient in the vaa.

accounts.name: vaa
docs: Verified Wormhole message account. The Wormhole program verified
signatures and posted the account data here. Read-only.

accounts.name: temporary_account
docs: Program's temporary token account. This account is created before the
instruction is invoked to temporarily take custody of the payer's
tokens. When the tokens are finally bridged in, the tokens will be
transferred to the destination token accounts. This account will have
zero balance and can be closed.

accounts.name: token_bridge_claim
docs: is true if the bridged assets have been claimed. If the transfer has
not been redeemed, this account will not exist yet.
NOTE: The Token Bridge program's claim account is only initialized when
a transfer is redeemed (and the boolean value `true` is written as
its data).
The Token Bridge program will automatically fail if this transfer
is redeemed again. But we choose to short-circuit the failure as the
first evaluation of this instruction.

accounts.name: token_bridge_foreign_endpoint
docs: endpoint per chain, but the PDA allows for multiple endpoints for each
chain! We store the proper endpoint for the emitter chain.

accounts.name: token_bridge_custody
docs: account that holds this mint's balance. This account needs to be
unchecked because a token account may not have been created for this
mint yet. Mutable.
# Exclusive
Native transfer only.

accounts.name: token_bridge_custody_signer
docs: # Exclusive
Native transfer only.

accounts.name: token_bridge_mint_authority
docs: # Exclusive
Wrapped transfer only.

accounts.name: token_bridge_wrapped_meta
docs: about the token from its native chain:
* Wormhole Chain ID
* Token's native contract address
* Token's native decimals
# Exclusive
Wrapped transfer only.

instructions.name: confirm_owner_transfer_request
docs: The new owner confirms to be so.

accounts.name: new_owner_badge
docs: The admin badge for the new owner.

accounts.name: tbr_config
docs: Program Config account. This program requires that the [`signer`] specified
in the context equals a pubkey specified in this account. Mutable,
because we will update roles depending on the operation.

accounts.name: owner
docs: Owner of the program as set in the [`OwnerConfig`] account.

accounts.name: admin_badge
docs: The admin badge for the owner.

accounts.name: tbr_config
docs: Owner Config account. This program requires that the `owner` specified
in the context equals the pubkey specified in this account. Mutable.

instructions.name: register_peer
docs: Register a new peer for the given chain.
# Authorization
Owner or Admin.

accounts.name: signer
docs: Owner or admin of the program as set in the [`TbrConfig`] account.

accounts.name: admin_badge
docs: Proof that the signer is an admin or the owner.

accounts.name: tbr_config
docs: Owner Config account. This program requires that the `signer` specified
in the context equals an authorized pubkey specified in this account.

instructions.name: relaying_fee
docs: Returns a quote for a transfer.

accounts.name: tbr_config
docs: This program's config.

accounts.name: chain_config
docs: The peer config. We need to verify that the transfer is sent to the
canonical peer.

instructions.name: remove_admin
docs: Removes a previously added admin account.

accounts.name: signer
docs: The signer can be the owner or an admin.

accounts.name: admin_badge
docs: If the signer is an admin, prove it with this PDA.

accounts.name: tbr_config
docs: Program Config account. This program requires that the [`owner`] specified
in the context equals the owner role stored in the config.

instructions.name: set_pause_for_outbound_transfers
docs: Forbids or allows any outbound transfer, *i.e.* from this chain.
# Authorization
Owner or Admin.

accounts.name: signer
docs: Owner as set in the [`TbrConfig`] account, or an admin.

accounts.name: admin_badge
docs: Proof that the signer is an admin or the owner.

accounts.name: tbr_config
docs: Program Config account. This program requires that the [`signer`] specified
in the context equals a pubkey specified in this account. Mutable,
because we will update roles depending on the operation.

instructions.name: submit_owner_transfer_request
docs: Updates the owner account. This needs to be either cancelled or approved.

accounts.name: tbr_config
docs: Program Config account. This program requires that the [`signer`] specified
in the context equals a pubkey specified in this account. Mutable,
because we will update roles depending on the operation.

accounts.name: payer
docs: Payer will pay Wormhole fee to transfer tokens and create temporary
token account.

accounts.name: tbr_config
docs: This program's config.

accounts.name: chain_config
docs: The peer config. We need to verify that the transfer is sent to the
canonical peer.

accounts.name: mint
docs: Mint info. This is the SPL token that will be bridged over to the
canonical peer. Mutable.
In the case of a native transfer, it's the native mint; in the case of a
wrapped transfer, it's the token wrapped by Wormhole.

accounts.name: user_token_account
docs: Payer's token account. It holds the SPL token that will be transferred.

accounts.name: temporary_account
docs: Program's temporary token account. This account is created before the
instruction is invoked to temporarily take custody of the payer's
tokens. When the tokens are finally bridged out, the token account
will have zero balance and can be closed.

accounts.name: fee_recipient
docs: Fee recipient's account. The fee will be transferred to this account.

accounts.name: token_bridge_custody
docs: account that holds this mint's balance. This account needs to be
unchecked because a token account may not have been created for this
mint yet. Mutable.
# Exclusive
Native transfer only.

accounts.name: token_bridge_custody_signer
docs: # Exclusive
Native transfer only.

accounts.name: token_bridge_wrapped_meta
docs: about the token from its native chain:
* Wormhole Chain ID
* Token's native contract address
* Token's native decimals
# Exclusive
Wrapped transfer only.

accounts.name: wormhole_message
docs: tokens transferred in this account for our program. Mutable.

accounts.name: payer_sequence
docs: Used to keep track of payer's Wormhole sequence number.

instructions.name: update_canonical_peer
docs: Set a different peer as canonical.
# Authorization
Owner.

accounts.name: owner
docs: Owner of the program as set in the [`TbrConfig`] account.

accounts.name: tbr_config
docs: Owner Config account. This program requires that the `owner` specified
in the context equals the `owner` pubkey specified in this account.

instructions.name: update_evm_transaction_config
docs: Updates the transaction size of the EVM receiving side.
# Authorization
Owner or Admin.

accounts.name: signer
docs: The signer may be the owner, or admin, depending on the operation.

accounts.name: admin_badge
docs: Proof that the signer is an admin or the owner.

accounts.name: tbr_config
docs: Program Config account. This program requires that the [`signer`] specified
in the context equals a pubkey specified in this account. Mutable,
because we will update roles depending on the operation.

instructions.name: update_fee_recipient
docs: Updates the account to which the fees will be sent.
# Authorization
Owner or Admin.

accounts.name: signer
docs: The signer may be the owner, or admin, depending on the operation.

accounts.name: admin_badge
docs: Proof that the signer is an admin or the owner.

accounts.name: tbr_config
docs: Program Config account. This program requires that the [`signer`] specified
in the context equals a pubkey specified in this account. Mutable,
because we will update roles depending on the operation.

instructions.name: update_max_gas_dropoff
docs: What is the maximum allowed gas dropoff for this chain.
# Authorization
Owner or Admin.

accounts.name: signer
docs: Owner as set in the [`TbrConfig`] account, or an admin.

accounts.name: admin_badge
docs: Proof that the signer is an admin or the owner.

accounts.name: tbr_config
docs: Program Config account. This program requires that the [`signer`] specified
in the context equals a pubkey specified in this account. Mutable,
because we will update roles depending on the operation.

instructions.name: update_relayer_fee
docs: Updates the value of the relayer fee, *i.e.* the flat USD amount
to pay for a transfer to be done.
# Authorization
Owner or Admin.

accounts.name: signer
docs: Owner as set in the [`TbrConfig`] account, or an admin.

accounts.name: admin_badge
docs: Proof that the signer is an admin or the owner.

accounts.name: tbr_config
docs: Program Config account. This program requires that the [`signer`] specified
in the context equals a pubkey specified in this account. Mutable,
because we will update roles depending on the operation.

types.name: AdminState
docs: A peer chain. Nothing is stored in it for now.

types.name: ChainConfigState
docs: The config for a single chain.

fields.name: relayer_fee
docs: The fee for the relayer, in μUSD.

types.name: EvmPricesAccount
docs: EVM chains prices.

fields.name: gas_price
docs: The gas price / base fee for the Ethereum transaction, in Mwei/gas.

fields.name: price_per_byte
docs: Regulates the cost of including data blobs in Ethereum transactions, in Mwei/byte.

fields.name: gas_token_price
docs: The gas price in μusd/Mwei.

types.name: PeerState
docs: A peer chain. Nothing is stored in it for now.

types.name: PriceOracleConfigAccount
docs: The program's main account.

fields.name: owner
docs: Program's owner.

fields.name: admin
docs: Program's admin. Can be used to update the prices or appoint a new assistant.

fields.name: assistant
docs: Program's assistant. Can be used to update the prices.

fields.name: pending_owner
docs: Intermediate storage for the pending owner. Is used to transfer ownership.

fields.name: sol_price
docs: The SOL price in μusd/SOL.

types.name: SignerSequenceState
docs: Adds a number to a user's message PDA seed, so that a different account is
generated every transfer.

types.name: TbrConfigState
docs: The program's main account.

fields.name: owner
docs: Program's owner.

fields.name: pending_owner
docs: Intermediate storage for the pending owner. Is used to transfer ownership.
